timeline.message:
Remove Map null annotation workarounds

These workarounds to prevent false positives can be removed now the EEAs allow for proper null analysis.

Signed-off-by: Wouter Born <github@maindrain.net>

timeline.bodyText: Did you check that the array can be null but all array contents are non-null? I would expect that the array is nonnull but it contents are nullable, so @Nullable Playlist[] would be correct.
timeline.author: J-N-K

replies.author: wborn

replies.bodyText: Mh. Good point. Then the annotation was wrong before (and not work-around related (because the members of the array are not what determines the result of Map.get but the array itself.
replies.author: J-N-K

timeline.author: J-N-K

timeline.bodyText: From my understanding this is not a workaround but reflects the null-values from the JSON response (also immediately below)
timeline.author: J-N-K

timeline.bodyText: I'm also not sure here, it could be that the json response contains null-values in null-arrays
timeline.author: J-N-K
